title: Please Work With Rogers Canada to Correct Routing Problems
body: For probably close to if not longer than 2 months now it is a complete crap-shoot each game whether or not I get my normal 26 ping, 35-45 ping, or even as high as 55-70 ping each game. I remedied my ISP's routing issues by using the WTFast VPN but it has inconsistencies of it's own. Please Riot, every time I try to get help from ISP they just try to sell me things. Please...

replies.body:
Routing issues are generally caused by packet loss or latency spikes at specific hops along your route to the server. Because resolving these types of issues require a lot of context for an ISP tech to investigate, it's possible that the tech you spoke to at your ISP simply didn't have the right context to resolve the issue. In order to get the right context, I recommend running a set of traceroutes, which will provide an in-depth look at your route to the server. You can run a set using our [instructions here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) or with a network tool called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/), running it for 5 minutes with the IP address 192.64.170.1, then exporting your results as text.

You can then [submit a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with our tech specialists and attach that traceroute log so they can  point out specific nodes (hops) where your connection is experiencing issues.

Let me know if you have any questions.
I am with rogers as well and it is terrible. PLEASE PLEASE contact rogers and fix the issue, I would really love to play league again (can't even play ranked).

I also want to point out: after my previous post to you, I went ahead and contacted Rogers and followed up with them on my previous ticket. Turns out they had closed it (without telling me) and determined that the issue is **_NOT_** on their end.

And despite all my explaining of traceroutes and such, they were VERY persistent in telling me the issue is **_NOT_** something they can fix, and even went as far as to tell me that the problem is not on their end.

They need to be contacted by an actual tech support person who actually knows all the technical terms and actually knows how to PROVE the issue is on their end and force them to investigate it, and **_investigate it properly._** Considering Riot built an entire fucking network to make their game run better, you would think Riot would have someone qualified to contact the ISP and explain the issue to them and get it fixed.

If this keeps up I will probably quit League. Helping my ISP to fix their issues would go a long way toward keeping me as a paying customer of Riot Games, and buying RP. (**_MY ISP IS EVEN PARTNERED WITH YOU, this means you have the appropriate business contacts to get this solved_**)
